conclusion: To find the ratio of the tension of the rope to the force exerted by the pillow on the child, analyze the forces acting on the system.
The metal guide rail is fixed at an angle α with a narrow groove containing a small ball. One end of the rope is connected to the ball, and the other end is connected to a pillow.
Identify forces: tension in the rope \( T \), gravitational force \( (m_1 + m_2)g \), and normal force exerted by the pillow on the child.
The system is in motion along the inclined plane with gravitational force component \( (m_1 + m_2)g \sin \alpha \).
Tension \( T \) in the rope balances the gravitational force component parallel to the incline: \( T = (m_1 + m_2)g \sin \alpha \).
The vertical component of the gravitational force is \( (m_1 + m_2)g \cos \alpha \), providing the normal force exerted by the pillow on the child.
The ratio of the tension in the rope to the normal force is \( \frac{(m_1 + m_2)g \sin \alpha}{(m_1 + m_2)g \cos \alpha} = \frac{\sin \alpha}{\cos \alpha} = \tan \alpha \).
Since β is constant and represents the angle between the rope and the vertical, \( \tan \alpha = \tan \beta \).
The ratio of the tension of the rope to the force exerted by the pillow on the child is \( \tan \beta \).
